title: Hundreds of families flee Syrian town of Afrin: Observatory
text: March 16, 2018 / 7:19 AM / Updated 37 minutes ago Hundreds of families flee Syrian town of Afrin: Observatory Reuters Staff 1 Min Read BEIRUT (Reuters) - Hundreds of families fled the Syrian town of Afrin towards nearby villages held by pro-Syrian government forces overnight as Turkish forces shelled the town, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said. People sit in a truck with their belongings in the north east of Afrin, Syria March 15, 2018. REUTERS/Khalil Ashawi Turkish forces and allied Syrian militias are targeting Afrin in an offensive against the Kurdish YPG militia in northwestern Syria. The Observatory said families left the town in buses and cars towards Nubl and al-Zahra, Shiâ€™ite Muslim villages that are loyal to the government of President Bashar al-Assad. The Syrian government has sided with the YPG against Turkey in Afrin. Writing by Tom Perry; Editing by Andrew Heavens
